class vizasm.analysis.security.filter.BackgroundTasksFilter.BackgroundTasksFilter(name=None, methodcall=None)[source]¶

Bases: vizasm.analysis.security.filter.SecurityFilter.SecurityFilter

Check for background tasks.

Methods

add_to_graph(graph[, ...]) This method adds the SecurityFilter to the graph and configures its attributes.
attribute_dictionary() Merge viz attributes and filter description and return the dictionary
config_filter_method_call() Filter on a method call.
config_filter_method_definition() Filter on the method definition.
config_ios_filter() Return if SecurityFilters is only for iOS
config_mac_filter()
description() The full description of the filter
filter() Filter the MethodCall according to the filter and replace the old one with the filtered one.
filter_method_call(function)
filter_method_definition(method) Filter on the method definition.
get_gexf_viz_attr_dict()
get_methodcall()
get_name()
get_size() Returns the subdictionary with the size key keeping structure of the dictionary
get_viz_color_dict() Returns the subdictionary with the color key keeping structure of the dictionary
node_color_blue()
node_color_green()
node_color_red()
node_color_transparency() Transparency of the node
node_size()
set_gexf_viz_attr_dict(value)
set_methodcall(value)
set_name(value)

Check the SSL level of a CFStream.

Methods

attribute_dictionary() Merge viz attributes and filter description and return the dictionary
config_filter_method_call() Filter on a method call.
config_filter_method_definition() Filter on the method definition.
config_ios_filter() Return if SecurityFilters is only for iOS
config_mac_filter() Return if SecurityFilters is only for mac
description() The full description of the filter
filter() Filter the MethodCall according to the filter and replace the old one with the filtered one.
filter_method_call(function)
filter_method_definition(method) Filter on the method definition.
get_gexf_viz_attr_dict()
get_methodcall()
get_name()
get_size() Returns the subdictionary with the size key keeping structure of the dictionary

node_color_blue()
node_color_green()
node_color_red()
node_color_transparency() Transparency of the node
node_size()
set_gexf_viz_attr_dict(value)
set_methodcall(value)
set_name(value)

class vizasm.analysis.security.filter.SecurityFilter.SecurityFilter(name=None, methodcall=None)[source]¶

Bases: object, vizasm.vizasm_networkx.AddMethodCallToGraphInterface.AddMethodCallToGraphInterface, vizasm.vizasm_networkx.AttributeNodeInterface.AttributeNodeInterface, vizasm.vizasm_networkx.AttributeDictInterface.AttributeDictInterface

BaseClass for a security filter.

Parameters:

_methodcall: MethodCall :

the MethodCall to analyze

_name: string, optional :

the name of the SecurityFilter is used for the node representation in the graph. If no name is given, the class name will be used instead.

—– :

Subclasses need to overwrite the following methods: :

filter_method_call or filter_method_definition config_ methods _description

Methods

add_to_graph(graph[, ...]) This method adds the SecurityFilter to the graph and configures its attributes.
attribute_dictionary() Merge viz attributes and filter description and return the dictionary
config_filter_method_call() Filter on a method call.

set_name(value)
add_to_graph(graph, methodcall_sender_attr_dict=None, methodcall_calls_attr_list_dict=None, sender_methodcall_edge_attr_dict=None)[source]¶

This method adds the SecurityFilter to the graph and configures its attributes.

Moreover it configures the attributes for the sender and call nodes of the MethodCall. But the supplied attribute dictionaries may overwrite attributes specified here.

The nodes, as well as the edges between them, are configured with the same color as the SecurityFilter. The weight of the edges are the sizes of the nodes.

attribute_dictionary()[source]¶

Merge viz attributes and filter description and return the dictionary

config_filter_method_call()[source]¶

Filter on a method call. A function call being made inside a method implementation. You can filter for method calls and method definition at the same time!

config_filter_method_definition()[source]¶

Filter on the method definition. This means that all calls that are made in this method, will be kept.

If you successfully filter on a method, no further filtering for method calls will be done.

E.g. on “- (BOOL)application:(UIApplication *)application didFinishLaunchingWithOptions:(NSDictionary *)launchOptions)” (in the original source)

config_ios_filter()[source]¶

Return if SecurityFilters is only for iOS

config_mac_filter()[source]¶

Return if SecurityFilters is only for mac

description()[source]¶

The full description of the filter

filter()[source]¶

Filter the MethodCall according to the filter and replace the old one with the filtered one.

Define with the config_ methods if you want to filter on the method calls or the method definition (or both).

If filtering on the method definition is successful, all function calls will be kept. Otherwise the function calls will be filtered.

filter_method_call(function)[source]¶

This method is used for the filtering and shall be overwritten by any subclass. It should return false for all the objects that shall be filtered out. The objects for which true is returned are the ones that will be kept.

Parameters:

function: FunctionInterface :

the FunctionInterface to filter
Returns:

True :

if the object shall be kept

False :

if the object is not of any relevance
filter_method_definition(method)[source]¶

Filter on the method definition.

Parameters:method: MsgSend :
get_methodcall()[source]¶
get_name()[source]¶
methodcall¶

_methodcall(MethodCall) – the MethodCall to analyze

name¶

_name(string) – the name of the SecurityFilter is used for the node representation in the graph.

node_color_blue()[source]¶
node_color_green()[source]¶
node_color_red()[source]¶

set_name(value)[source]¶
